Кровавые ритуалы подошли к концу. Лишь жертвенные ямы, переполненные гниющими трупами, и засохшая черная кровь на ступенях алтарей свидетельствует об ужасах, что происходили в ваших владениях. Свеживатель Душ доволен вами.

Много слухов ходило за вашей спиной. Те, кто знал вас очень близко, явно заметили перемены в вас, но не придали этому большего значения. Как же сильно они ошибались! Но теперь всем известно, что вы сделали. Нет больше смысла скрывать свои истинные намерения.

Уже через пару месяцев сложно было не заметить эти гигантские ветви, тянущиеся к небу, далеко на горизонте.  Семя, которое было посажено в [target_province.GetName], спустя многие месяцы превратилось в исполинское древо. Его могучая крона укрыла многие мирные поселения поблизости и продолжает привлекать новых поселенцев и пилигримов к массивным корням. Новое мировое древо выглядит несокрушимым, но это далеко не так. Защитники этого святого места должны быть готовы стоять до последнего вздоха против врагов, угрожающих древу.
Ха! Эти еретики молятся большому дереву!

Использовать силы Древний Богов, чтобы осквернить Мировое Древо.

Длительное присутствие Древних Богов в [target_province.GetName] оставило неизлечимый шрам. Жизнь покинула близлежащий рощи и темная магия Изумрудного Кошмара пришла занять её место. Некогда могущественное мировое древо сбросило свою листву, оставив изуродованные черные ветви. Кровавые леса, раскинувшиеся у корней древа, заполонили нечестивые чудовища и многочисленные алтари, воздвигнутые во славу Древних Богов. Гробовая тишина нависла над рощей… иногда прерываемая едва слышимым шепотом. Это гиблое место окончательно потеряно. Лишь огонь способен очистить его.
Лучше не приближаться к тем местам.
Это массивное дерево когда-то было мировым древом, но теперь оно безвозвратно осквернено Изумрудным Кошмаром, болезненной скверной Древних Богом внутри Изумрудного Сна.
В одном из храмов этой провинции есть растущее или существующее мировое древо.
Сжечь Мировое Древо. Это приведет в ярость приверженцев шаманизма и друидизма.
This character has burned a world tree. This is a terrible crime against many creatures of Azeroth. Этот персонаж сжег Мировое Древо. Это ужасное преступление против многих существ Азерота.

Даже в ночи, ярчайший свет заливает леса [target_province.GetName]. Огонь горящего мирового древа сияет будто восходящее солнце далеко на горизонте. Здания, расположенные под корнями, моментально складываются будто карточные домики под весом падающих тлеющих ветвей. Огонь, охвативший мировое древо, за пару мгновений перебросился на поселения, а затем на близлежащие леса. Именно там, многие из тех, кто пытался убежать, были застигнуты врасплох, когда кольцо огня заперло их внутри горящего ада.

Даже в ночи, ярчайший свет заливает леса [target_province.GetName]. Огонь горящего кошмарного древа сияет будто восходящее солнце далеко на горизонте. Алтари, расположенные под корнями, моментально складываются будто карточные домики под весом падающих гнилостных ветвей. Огонь, охвативший кошмарное древо, за пару мгновений перебросился на ритуальные комплексы, а затем на близлежащие леса. Нет слов, чтобы описать зловоние дыма, исходившего от этого горящего ада.

Ваша армия достигла мирового древа, находящегося в [target_province.GetName]. Его размеры поражают. Гигантские ветви раскинулись на многие километры. Это дерево поистине является сердцем этого региона, источником жизни и надежды. Требуется лишь одна иска, чтобы сломить дух обороняющихся и превратить эту провинцию в выжженную пустошь.

Ваша армия достигла кошмарного древа, находящегося в [target_province.GetName]. Его размеры поражают. Гниющие ветви раскинулись на многие километры. Через свои корни, древо распространяет свой яд все дальше и дальше. Если мы хотим очистить это место, мы должны предать древо огню, превратить эту провинцию в выжженную пустошь.
Мы не могли помочь этому дереву...
Рядом с храмом под названием [target_title.GetName], вы вскопали землю и посадил священное семя. Пока это лишь беззащитный росток. Вы покидаете рощу с надеждой, что он выдержит испытание времени.

После падения Нордрассила, ночные эльфы потеряли бессмертие. Благословление Аспекта Времени, бронзового дракона Ноздорму, исчезло, столкнув эльфов с невзгодами смертной жизни. Вспышки болезней унесли немало эльфийских жизней, в основном детей и стариков, которые еще помнят времена Войны Древних. Все что остается эльфам — адаптироваться к суровым условиям новой реальности.

In the far reaches of the west, a falling star has crashed upon the relatively peaceful island of Azuremyst. Several pieces and chunks of crystal from the celestial body have scattered across the island chain, contaminating the local ecosystem. We have learned that this crashed object is no simple meteoric rock, but rather a dimensional ship carrying a host of humanoids departed from the shattered world of Draenor, the birthplace of the Horde. These people call themselves the Draenei, a race of Light-wielding priests, mages, and artificers descended from the same race of Eredar that threatened Azeroth not so long ago. They have crash landed here on Azeroth in an attempt to escape the Legion's onslaught with the help of a being seemingly made of pure Light, O'ros. Even now, the Draenei work to craft a new home for themselves here on Azeroth, centered around the crashed dimensional ship, to which they refer to as the Exodar.
They can run, but they can not hide!
As if we hadn't enough trouble with those curs back on Draenor.
This is an unexpected turn of events.

Having left the eastern kingdoms during the turmoil, the human settlers of Theramore have been quick to adapt to their new home on the continent of Kalimdor. The intermingling of various human cultures in the young kingdom has led to the formation of a new united identity for those who were simply pioneers and refugees before. Now more than ever, Theramore continues to develop into a legitimate human fiefdom not unlike the Seven Kingdoms of old.
Theramore is here to stay. Or is it?

The Orcish settlement of Kalimdor has brought all the Orcish clans of the Horde together within the nation known as Durotar. For many years, the members of these clans have coexisted with each other in an united effort to develop their new homeland in Kalimdor. As a result, the Orcish people have risen beyond the old divisions brought wrought by tribal clan hierarchies and customs and have bonded together to form a new identity for all of Orc-kind on Azeroth.

Not many humans would dare to venture into such dangerous corner of the world as the Southern Kalimdor. Those who did found their daily lives a constant struggle to survive. However, after years of living in these dangerous lands, they managed to adapt and prosper, usually by resorting to shady practices. The commonality they shared became much more than one of necessity. These humans became known as the Wastewanders, the menace of the southern sands.
We'll see what comes out of this.

After the discovery of Kalimdor by the humans, many of them settled around the eastern coasts of the western continent. But there's also a group of those who were searching for a new home deep in the wild frontiers of a strange new land, slowly fostering an identity of their own as they look to the future away from the human kingdoms of old.
The Empire of Zul is Reborn

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has done the unthinkable. Pursuing the mighty heritage of an ancient civilization, [From.GetSheHe] subjugated the five Troll empires of Azeroth and proclaimed [From.GetHerselfHimself] the supreme Emperor of Trollkind. Thousands of trolls rush to the streets of their major cities to celebrate the long awaited restoration of the ancient Empire of Zul.

The Empire of Zul was the progenitor of the five troll empires of contemporary era. Many trolls look fondly to the times of their supremacy, and perhaps one day a great leader will make the grandeur of the united Troll empire shine upon Azeroth once more.

Observing the movements of the stars at night, you have begun to see some regular patterns. These observations, however, have raised many new questions. You are starting to wonder, for example, why are there two moons?

One morning, your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to see you. [From.GetSheHeCap] says: 'I am worried. I have heard that you are spending late nights studying the sky and entertaining heretical notions about the Great Dark. I would ask that you stop, for your own sake.'
You nightly studies of the movements of the celestial bodies are increasing your knowledge of a great many things. You feel that you are getting closer to understanding the Great Dark Beyond.

You studies of the celestial spheres are progressing well. You see movements and relationships that you had never dared guess at. It seems clear to you now that the laws that guide the movements of the stars must also be reflected on Azeroth in some way...
You are sure you have made a breakthrough in your studies. Yes, it cannot be otherwise. The core of Azeroth is constantly in motion as if it is alive. How little we know of this planet!

One morning, your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to see you. [From.GetSheHeCap] says: 'I am worried. I have heard that you are spending late nights staring at the sky, speaking in odd riddles and entertaining heretical notions about the Great Dark. I would ask that you stop, for your own sake.'

The studies you have conducted in your observatory have convinced you that there are many strange things beyond the Great Dark. There are few sources and no one to share knowledge with you, however. But you have heard of a strange troll witch in the Great Sea who is rumored to possess vast knowledge of the weird.
I will go and see her.

You arrive at the abode of the strange troll witch. After some persuasion, she invites you in. You speak at length, and she tells of you of the Runemaster Molgeim, who knew many things of the strange spheres beyond and of talking beings as old as the universe itself. You find out that Molgeim wrote a book called Shath'mag, in which he recorded many strange and unholy truths. The witch says that as she is impressed by your sincerity and desire for knowledge, she can sell you a copy of the book. She tells you to beware, however, as too much intense study of Shath'mag is said to drive the reader insane...

Shortly after the death of your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick], you are brought a strange piece of news. It seems that [From.GetHerHis] library was raided, the only item stolen being a strange old book of unknown origin. Two servants who were in the library at the time were found dead, though witnesses refused to describe the state of the bodies.

The book you bought from the strange troll witch has proven quite useful for gaining new ideas and insights in your studies of the stars and what lies beyond. It does, however, contain some quite disturbing texts and images, things that lead towards a level of understanding that might make one... mad.

Crown Prince Arthas Menethil of Lordaeron, is the son of King Terenas Menethil II. The young prince grew up as the First and Second Wars ravaged the continent, during this time he befriended King Varian Wrynn of Stormwind. Trained by Muradin Bronzebeard in combat, while his adopted uncle Uther the Lightbringer taught him the ways of the Light, becoming a revered paladin in the Order of the Silver Hand. The romantic relationship with Lady Jaina Proudmoore caused a rivalry with Prince Kael'thas Sunstrider of Quel'thalas by the elven prince's own interest in the young sorceress. However, the young prince is beloved by his people and would do anything to protect them. Even with his promising upbringing, a threat in the very heart of his kingdom will shake the foundations of his world.

Ner'zhul of the Shadowmoon clan, once it's chieftain and elder shaman was one of the most respectable leaders among all of the orcish clans on Draenor, an advisor to all shamans regardless of their affiliation. Gul'dan, a powerful warlock had severed the connection to the elements on Draenor, thus not giving Ner'zhul the comfort of communicating with his deceased wife. His deep grief was soon preyed upon by Kil'jaeden who began visiting his dreams as his departed wife, and was told to form the Orcish Horde. Ner'zhul was turned into the Legion's pawn from the day he formed the Horde, and deceived into Kil'jaeden's realm where he was torn apart and transformed into the Lich King.

Lord Admiral Daelin Proudmoore is the ruler of the island nation of Kul'tiras, which was founded after the Troll Wars. Kul'tiras have the largest navy of the human kingdoms, with daring sailors and bold captains traveling across the seas, exploring the coasts of the Eastern Kingdoms. Just like his people, Daelin is a proud explorer and seafarer. And he will have a role to play in Azeroth's future.

Warchief Go'el, son of Durutan. Was found by Aedelas Blackmoore who raised and trained him into a gladiator. After escaping Blackmoore's grasp, he fled into the wilderness of Lordaeron to find the remaining free orcs. When he found his people, he heard about the undefeated Grom Hellscream of the Warsong clan, a bond grew between the two orcs after they first met. Go'el then saught out the chieftain the Frostwolf Clan, Dek'thar. Go'el was the first shaman accepted by the spirits since Drek'Thar's generation. Go'el became Warchief Doomhammer's second-in-command and after his death during the liberation of their people from the internment camps became the warchief. Their people sailed across the seas, finding new allies and foes on their journey to Kalimdor where they established a new home for the Horde.

King Terenas Menethil II of Lordaeron, was born in the court of Loradaeron as a member of the royal family, which had ruled the kingdom for generations. He grew up to become a wise and just ruler, beloved by his people for bringing prosperity and peace for most of his long reign. He is an old friend of Thoras Trollbane, the king of Stromgarde and that could play a crucial role in the future. However, now with rumours of a new threat coming from beyond Azeroth, as the ruler of the largest human kingdom Terenas must prepare his banners for war as the very fate of this world could very well be in his hands.
